info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 24 at 4:24PM MDT until June 24 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
FFWABQ
The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Central Valencia County in central New Mexico...
* Until 630 PM MDT.
* At 424 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Los Lunas, Belen, Valencia, Bosque Farms, Los Chaves, Tome, Los Trujillos-Gabaldon, Rio Communities North, Rio Communities and Jarales.
This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 185 and 206.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels and debris flow within vulnerable drainages along the Cotton Fire burn area.
